page.title: 16HEDGE SURVEY, SOMERFORD AREA
page.content: We visited several areas of hedgerow near Little Somerford and we found out the following.The hedges are about 1m 70 cm tall and 75 cm wide.Most of the hedges we looked at were made of mainly hawthorn and hazel,but we also identified:willow,dogrose,flowering dogwood,elm,hedge maple, blackberry, bluebery, cow parsley, nettle, celandine, herb robert, red campion, foxglove and bitter sweet.Bitter sweet is a poisonous plant used in medicine. The flowers smell rather like mice. It has five purple petals and a yellow centre.The plant likes a damp soil.It is very easy to recognise. We also saw a rare butterfly called a Marbled White.There were many crickets and birds called White Throats.We noticed a few Hoverflies and lots of Ladybirds.
